subject: Climate & Environment
title: Single-Use Plastics
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Single-Use Plastics.

hook.text: A plastic bag is used for an average of 12 minutes. It can persist in nature for 500 years.

buildup.text: Straws, cups, cutlery, and packaging make up the bulk of ocean and street litter.

discovery.text: Half of all plastic ever made was produced in just the last 15 years â€” mostly single-use.

twist.text: Many countries are banning single-use plastics. Over 120 nations now restrict plastic bags.

climax.text: But bans alone won't solve it. The world still produces 400 million tons of plastic per year.

punchline.text: We use it once and the planet carries it forever.

quiz.question: How long can a plastic bag persist in the environment?
